problems.title: Least Common Multiple of Two Numbers
problems.description:
The least common multiple (LCM) of two integers a and b is the smallest positive integer that is divisible by both a and b.

You are given two integers a and b. Find their LCM.

Input Format:
Two space-separated integers a and b.

Output Format:
Print a single integer, the LCM of a and b.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4 6

Sample Output
12

Sample Input
7 5

Sample Output
35
problems.constraints:
1 <= a, b <= 10^9
The LCM will fit in 64-bit signed integer.
hintsList: Use the formula lcm(a, b) = (a / gcd(a, b)) * b. First compute gcd with Euclid's algorithm.
